security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Uses only standard file read tools to detect PLAN.md status. Behavior matches stated purpose perfectly. No network access, no external commands, no credential access.

content.user_title: Track project plans and detect stale documentation
content.value_statement: Project plans often become outdated as work progresses. This skill monitors docs/PLAN.md and alerts you when plans are stale compared to git activity, suggesting appropriate commands to sync or update your documentation.
actual_capabilities: Detects when docs/PLAN.md exists or is missing
Identifies stale plans by comparing last modified date to git commits
Suggests appropriate session commands like /save and /sync
Warns when plan is outdated relative to recent git activity
limitations: Only works with docs/PLAN.md file location
Only suggests commands, does not execute them
Cannot track plans outside the standard location

use_cases.title: Track project progress
use_cases.description: Keep project plans synchronized with actual development work by detecting when documentation falls behind commits

use_cases.title: Monitor plan updates
use_cases.description: Ensure project plans stay current and identify when team members need to sync their documentation

use_cases.title: Maintain personal plans
use_cases.description: Stay on top of personal project goals by receiving reminders when plans have not been updated recently

prompt_templates.title: Check plan status
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to see if plan needs updating
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the status of my project plan. Is docs/PLAN.md up to date with recent git activity?

prompt_templates.title: Sync from git
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to update plan from recent commits
prompt_templates.prompt: My plan might be stale. Show me what has changed since my last plan update and suggest how to sync.

prompt_templates.title: Archive old plan
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to start fresh with a new plan
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to archive my current plan and create a new one. What is the best approach?

prompt_templates.title: Review progress
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to track milestone completion
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my project plan and git history. What progress have I made on my planned tasks? Which items are complete or in progress?

output_examples.input: Check if my project plan is up to date
output: Plan appears STALE - consider running /sync --git to update from commits
Modified files affecting plan: src/auth.ts, tests/api.test.ts

best_practices: Run a plan check at the start of each session to get context
Use /save after completing major milestones to document progress
Run /sync --git when returning after several days of work
Keep PLAN.md in docs/ directory for this skill to detect it
anti_patterns: Creating multiple plan files in different locations
Ignoring staleness warnings for extended periods
Manually editing PLAN.md without running /save to sync
Using /save without reviewing the plan content first

faq.question: Which file locations does this skill support?
faq.answer: Only docs/PLAN.md is supported. The skill requires the plan file to exist at this exact path relative to your project root.

faq.question: How does the skill define a stale plan?
faq.answer: A plan is stale when it has not been modified in over 3 days AND git shows commits since then, especially commits with feat:, fix:, or refactor: prefixes.

faq.question: What commands does this skill suggest?
faq.answer: The skill suggests /save to create or update plans, /sync to restore plan state, and /sync --git or /sync --status to update from git or review uncommitted changes.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only reads file metadata and git status. It does not modify files, access credentials, or send data anywhere.

faq.question: Why does the plan not update automatically?
faq.answer: This skill only suggests commands and never modifies plans directly. This ensures you maintain full control over your project documentation and can review changes before saving.

faq.question: How is this different from other planning tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on plan staleness awareness. It complements other planning tools by detecting when documentation drifts from actual work, using git history as the source of truth.
